name: Atlassian Plugin SDK - TGZ
description:
Cross-platform development environment


Supports Windows, OSX, Linux (Debian and RPM) and a standalone Java distribution for other platforms.



Develop and test locally


Easily create local installations of Jira, Confluence, Bamboo, Stash, Crowd or Fisheye/Crucible to test and debug your add-on.



Comprehensive developer documentation


Visit https://developer.atlassian.com for tutorials, best practices, reference documentation and tips & tricks.

screenshots.name: Local Jira start-up in under 2 minutes!

versions.releaseNotes:
Enhancement / Features:

ATLASSDK-178: Setting AMPS Version via command line argument (-u ) should override amps.version in POM

ATLASSDK-174: Release Atlassian SDK with default AMPS 8.0.1

ATLASSDK-172: Remove MaxPermSize=256M option in atlas-* commands

ATLASSDK-168: Deprecate atlas-cli


Bug fixes:

ATLASSDK-167: Allow the ajp port to be set similar to the http port for atlas-run-standalone / atlas-run / atlas-debug

ATLASSDK-162: atlas-install-plugin sets httpPort instead of http.port

ATLASSDK-161: atlas-integration-test does not work in 8.0.4

ATLASSDK-158: Build Failure 'Couldn't detect an AMPS plugin to dispatch to' on Linux/MAC

compatibleApplications.name: Jira
compatibleApplications.introduction: Nice one! Your team went JIRA. You've got a best-in-class issue tracker, but that's only the beginning. The Marketplace is brimming with apps for time-tracking, agile project management, test management, and integration with your other systems. Add-ons are ready to help make JIRA the best project tracker you've ever used.

compatibleApplications.name: Confluence
compatibleApplications.introduction: Confluence is the perfect tool for getting everyone on the same page. Create stunning visuals to explain your ideas, theme Confluence into a thing of beauty, or take advantage of powerful tools for technical writers. Whether your team is large or small, technical or Luddite, there's a Confluence add-on to get everyone in sync.

compatibleApplications.name: Fisheye/Crucible
compatibleApplications.introduction: Code review means better code. And with Crucible, code review gets a whole lot easier. Add-ons for Crucible integrate it with your IDE and JIRA and provide powerful reporting and statistics. What are you waiting for? Stop reading this, start reviewing code.

compatibleApplications.name: Bamboo
compatibleApplications.introduction: Builds! Tests! Deploys! Oh my! With Bamboo, you're one step closer to the dream of continuous integration and deployment. Let the collection of Bamboo add-ons help you get on your way with advanced reporting and powerful integrations. No matter what configuration you have, there's a Bamboo add-on to make your build agents work even better for you.

compatibleApplications.name: Crowd
compatibleApplications.introduction: Crowd is an identity management tool that handles authentication and authorization for web applications in one central location. It allows you to integrate the user bases of all your directories to be managed in one spot. Use it to centralize authentication for your Atlassian applications for all users. You can also use the API to centralize authentication for non-Atlassian applications. It also offers single sign-on for integrated applications (i.e. sign in once to one app, signs you into them all).

compatibleApplications.name: Bitbucket
compatibleApplications.introduction: DVCS is the future of source code management, and Bitbucket is the most powerful tool for managing Git repos in the cloud or on your own server.

versions.releaseNotes:
Bug fixes:

AMPS-1268: is broken in AMPS 6.0.4

AMPS-1279: amps 6.0.6 seems to ignore testGroups when running tests

AMPS-1280: Error starting Jira 7.0.0-OD-05-005 using atlas-run-standalone

AMPS-1285: Fecru, Confluence ITs test failed while running against JDK8

AMPS-1286: Skeleton plugins in platform 3 is still using old javax servlet artifact name

Enhancement / Features:

  • Separate SDK release from Plugin release
  • atlas-create-*-plugin archetypes should create version 3 plugin (transformerless)
  • Refactor AMPS create-*-plugin to use spring-scanner
  • Using Jira test data for restore dump file
  • Deliver QuickReload to AMPS
  • Add product and container version mapping
  • Update 6.1.x of AMPS to include new versions of fastdev and devtoolbox that work with Bitbbucket Server 4.0

AMPS-1160 allow overriding of all https settings for tomocat

AMPS-1159: Update atlassian-pdk to 2.3.2

AMPS-1161: Upgrade to Tomcat 8.0.9, the first stable version

AMPSDEV-40 match the version of atlassian-plugins-osgi-testrunner-bundle to that of atlassian-plugins-osgi-testrunner, if it's present in the module

compatibleApplications.name: Jira
compatibleApplications.introduction: Nice one! Your team went JIRA. You've got a best-in-class issue tracker, but that's only the beginning. The Marketplace is brimming with apps for time-tracking, agile project management, test management, and integration with your other systems. Add-ons are ready to help make JIRA the best project tracker you've ever used.

compatibleApplications.name: Confluence
compatibleApplications.introduction: Confluence is the perfect tool for getting everyone on the same page. Create stunning visuals to explain your ideas, theme Confluence into a thing of beauty, or take advantage of powerful tools for technical writers. Whether your team is large or small, technical or Luddite, there's a Confluence add-on to get everyone in sync.

compatibleApplications.name: Fisheye/Crucible
compatibleApplications.introduction: Code review means better code. And with Crucible, code review gets a whole lot easier. Add-ons for Crucible integrate it with your IDE and JIRA and provide powerful reporting and statistics. What are you waiting for? Stop reading this, start reviewing code.

compatibleApplications.name: Bamboo
compatibleApplications.introduction: Builds! Tests! Deploys! Oh my! With Bamboo, you're one step closer to the dream of continuous integration and deployment. Let the collection of Bamboo add-ons help you get on your way with advanced reporting and powerful integrations. No matter what configuration you have, there's a Bamboo add-on to make your build agents work even better for you.

compatibleApplications.name: Crowd
compatibleApplications.introduction: Crowd is an identity management tool that handles authentication and authorization for web applications in one central location. It allows you to integrate the user bases of all your directories to be managed in one spot. Use it to centralize authentication for your Atlassian applications for all users. You can also use the API to centralize authentication for non-Atlassian applications. It also offers single sign-on for integrated applications (i.e. sign in once to one app, signs you into them all).

compatibleApplications.name: Bitbucket
compatibleApplications.introduction: DVCS is the future of source code management, and Bitbucket is the most powerful tool for managing Git repos in the cloud or on your own server.

versions.summary: Upgrade Tomcat 8, upgrade PDK plugin. Fix HTTPS settings

screenshots.name: Local Jira start-up in under 2 minutes!

compatibleApplications.name: Jira
compatibleApplications.introduction: Nice one! Your team went JIRA. You've got a best-in-class issue tracker, but that's only the beginning. The Marketplace is brimming with apps for time-tracking, agile project management, test management, and integration with your other systems. Add-ons are ready to help make JIRA the best project tracker you've ever used.

compatibleApplications.name: Confluence
compatibleApplications.introduction: Confluence is the perfect tool for getting everyone on the same page. Create stunning visuals to explain your ideas, theme Confluence into a thing of beauty, or take advantage of powerful tools for technical writers. Whether your team is large or small, technical or Luddite, there's a Confluence add-on to get everyone in sync.

compatibleApplications.name: Fisheye/Crucible
compatibleApplications.introduction: Code review means better code. And with Crucible, code review gets a whole lot easier. Add-ons for Crucible integrate it with your IDE and JIRA and provide powerful reporting and statistics. What are you waiting for? Stop reading this, start reviewing code.

compatibleApplications.name: Bamboo
compatibleApplications.introduction: Builds! Tests! Deploys! Oh my! With Bamboo, you're one step closer to the dream of continuous integration and deployment. Let the collection of Bamboo add-ons help you get on your way with advanced reporting and powerful integrations. No matter what configuration you have, there's a Bamboo add-on to make your build agents work even better for you.

compatibleApplications.name: Crowd
compatibleApplications.introduction: Crowd is an identity management tool that handles authentication and authorization for web applications in one central location. It allows you to integrate the user bases of all your directories to be managed in one spot. Use it to centralize authentication for your Atlassian applications for all users. You can also use the API to centralize authentication for non-Atlassian applications. It also offers single sign-on for integrated applications (i.e. sign in once to one app, signs you into them all).

compatibleApplications.name: Bitbucket
compatibleApplications.introduction: DVCS is the future of source code management, and Bitbucket is the most powerful tool for managing Git repos in the cloud or on your own server.

It allows you to integrate the user bases of all your directories to be managed in one spot. Use it to centralize authentication for your Atlassian applications for all users. You can also use the API to centralize authentication for non-Atlassian applications. It also offers single sign-on for integrated applications (i.e. sign in once to one app, signs you into them all).

compatibleApplications.name: Bitbucket
compatibleApplications.introduction: DVCS is the future of source code management, and Bitbucket is the most powerful tool for managing Git repos in the cloud or on your own server.

versions.releaseNotes:
• Data Sources - you can now use custom datasources when starting our products with the SDK. See : https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/11337/using-mysql-instead-of-hsql-db-with-atlassian-pdk
  • Resource Compression - Weve updated the YUI compressor and also allow you to use Closure.
  • Fastdev 2.0 - Fastdev now uses the CLI / pi commands internally making it five times faster.
  • Wired test framework - Introduced in 4.0, in 4.1 weve made in-product wired tests even awesomer... they run inside the products, have dependencies injected, and report back to the local JUnit result collector making testing fun (again?)
  • Plugins Test Console - A new in-product UI for running ALL of your plugins tests. This one rocks. Run tests without product restarts, run all, single, or batches of tests, re-run failed, fastdev test code, etc. see video
  • Various bug fixes.

compatibleApplications.name: Jira
compatibleApplications.introduction: Nice one! Your team went JIRA. You've got a best-in-class issue tracker, but that's only the beginning. The Marketplace is brimming with apps for time-tracking, agile project management, test management, and integration with your other systems. Add-ons are ready to help make JIRA the best project tracker you've ever used.

compatibleApplications.name: Confluence
compatibleApplications.introduction: Confluence is the perfect tool for getting everyone on the same page. Create stunning visuals to explain your ideas, theme Confluence into a thing of beauty, or take advantage of powerful tools for technical writers. Whether your team is large or small, technical or Luddite, there's a Confluence add-on to get everyone in sync.

compatibleApplications.name: Fisheye/Crucible
compatibleApplications.introduction: Code review means better code. And with Crucible, code review gets a whole lot easier. Add-ons for Crucible integrate it with your IDE and JIRA and provide powerful reporting and statistics. What are you waiting for? Stop reading this, start reviewing code.

compatibleApplications.name: Bamboo
compatibleApplications.introduction: Builds! Tests! Deploys! Oh my! With Bamboo, you're one step closer to the dream of continuous integration and deployment. Let the collection of Bamboo add-ons help you get on your way with advanced reporting and powerful integrations. No matter what configuration you have, there's a Bamboo add-on to make your build agents work even better for you.

version.releaseNotes:
Enhancement / Features:

ATLASSDK-178: Setting AMPS Version via command line argument (-u ) should override amps.version in POM

ATLASSDK-174: Release Atlassian SDK with default AMPS 8.0.1

ATLASSDK-172: Remove MaxPermSize=256M option in atlas-* commands

ATLASSDK-168: Deprecate atlas-cli


Bug fixes:

ATLASSDK-167: Allow the ajp port to be set similar to the http port for atlas-run-standalone / atlas-run / atlas-debug

ATLASSDK-162: atlas-install-plugin sets httpPort instead of http.port

ATLASSDK-161: atlas-integration-test does not work in 8.0.4

ATLASSDK-158: Build Failure 'Couldn't detect an AMPS plugin to dispatch to' on Linux/MAC

reviews.review:
What? Nobody's bothered to review this Baby? I think of this plugin, thank Atlassian and the Developers who conceived, implemented and continue to support it every time I have to write a non-atlassian related stand alone application. Great work, guys, and Great Support. Thank You.
-wc
